review:
I went to this place on Wednesday for dinner. The outdoor sitting looks perfect if the weather is good and it was that day. Their was live music on acoustic guitar which added to the grace of the place.
In food, i tried veg fried platter which was amazing specially the onion rings and cheese balls. In main course, tried the garlic chilli noodles which were not at all on the spicier side but the quality was good. Their butter chicken is also worth having .
The staff was courteous and did their work really well. The service was on time.
Overall a great place to chill with friends over lumch or lunch.
name: The Flying Saucer Cafe

review: I went to this place last wednesday and made myself comfortable on a sofa sitting. Right in front of me was the live music ( guitar ) playing . The service was on time , infact they were quite fast. The ambiance is decent but i do miss their terrace which was operational before. So i tried the manchow soup here first along with crispy corn n peanut chaat combo. The soup was nice. Next i had cheese pao bhaji which came with 9 mini paos which were soft and bhaji was warm and good. The name cheese is because of of the paneer cutlet that comes along with it. Next we tried the cheese and mushroom fried rolls which i would recommend only to the mushroom lovers. Last starter we tried was...read more
name: Lord Of The Drinks

review:
I tried out this place yesterday. Its a new place almost 6 months old and it was on my list since some time.
What i liked the most the moment i reached here is its ambiance which is an outdoor open space.There is sitting arrangement right outside this outlet.

I tried veg biryani , chicken lolly and malai tikka roll.
It all tasted so good. The prices are pocket friendly. They also have beverages at very economic rate like tea, coffee, soup etc. They had a nice range of cold beverages as well
name: Lolly Wala

review:
I went here yesterday to bowl , play games and enjoy some delicious food. I really liked the service of the staff here. In food i loved the Lebanese platter and crispy corn . I also tried their dahi k kebabs which were fine and farmers veg pizza which looked amazing but lacked flavour.
I really enjoyed bowling , air hockey and other games.
Overall a great place to chill and have fun .
Recommendations -
1. Lebanese platter
2. Crispy corn
name: Smaaash

review:
Great packing. Great food . Great service.
In starters i would recommend kurkure spring roll and soya chaap. In main course, they have really nice hakka noodles for chinese lovers. In indian main course, i would recommend Angithi special handi chaap .
name: Punjabi Angithi

review: I visited this place sometime back in December and it was a lovely experience here. First of all a special shoutout to the amazing hospitality and courteous chef. Secondly, lets talk about the food. I loved their tomato shorba. I tried their veg and non veg platter . In main course , their dal baluchi is a must try for dal lovers. In desserts i tried gulab jamun and paan kulfi . Oh my god their kulfi is so flavoursome. Totally recommended !!
name: Baluchi - The Lalit New Delhi

review:
I ordeded tandoori chaap and mushroom tikka . Both of them were perfectly cooked. The chaap's massala was really nice. There were three chaaps in half plate as it is anywhere . The packing was also fine .
Overall my experience was fine .
name: Chinese Veg Crunch

review:
Teddy boy is based on the theme of England. Its different from other cliche places in CP. The sofas are really comfortable. 
The service is real quick and the staff is great. 
Coming to the food, i had Pao Bhaji , Butter Chicken Tacos , Veg burger , Cream Sauce Pasta and Brownie with vanilla ice cream. I loved the pao bhaji . The paos were soft and the bhaji for flavoursome. Too Good !! The tacos were basically butter chicken inside a kulcha presentable inside two small rickshaws. They tasted good . Also, their brownie is in-house and recommended for those who wish to eat dessert after their meal. 
Recommendations -
1. Pao Bhaji 
2. Tacos
name: Teddy Boy

review: I went to this place on Tuesday over lunch. Heard alot about their buffet with alot of cuisines and finally thought of trying . So there was Indian , chinese , japanese , European , Continental and Italian. I personally liked pao bhaji alot followed my mac and cheese , dahi bhalla and dal makhni . The place is good when you want to eat a lot of variety the same day. All your cravings will be fulfilled here. Just that i found noodles extra oily which could be worked upon to make the Chinese main course section a little stronger. In desserts too there are alot of options like Indian sweets , kheer , cone ice cream , cup ice cream and waffles. I tried the choco cone with small choco chips in...read more
name: The Marketplace

review:
A great buffet place with a variety of options both in starters and main course. Also, a go ahead for dessert lovers.
In starters, i really liked the crispy corn , paneer tikka , matar ki tikki and dahi papri. In main course, i liked the daal. In desserts i loved the variety of options they had kept as part of the buffet.
Overall a great place when you looking for a buffet option or having a great variety of food at affordable price.
name: The G.T. Road

review: I went to this place yesterday which was a Wednesday evening and the place was all ocuppied by 9pm. The band started around 9.15pm and the ambiance got totally LIT . The staff is really great and decent. The manager is very hospitable and brilliant in his work. In starters we had japaeno cheese potato sticks , chimmi changa rolls and chicken tikka, each of them cooked to perfection. In maim course just tried dal makhni and naan which was again praiseworthy. In desserts , tried brownie with vanilla. I guess a little work on the over sweet brownie could be done. Overall a great experience and an amazing service by the UC team . P.S - Just love the place because of its outdoor ambiance and...read more
name: Unplugged Courtyard

review: I went to this place sometime back for dinner. They have two floors, one indoor and another is terrace. It was quite hot so i avoided the terrace. There was loud music even around 8 o Clock . I had white sauce pasta. It tasted fine but was a little on the drier side. Next we had paneer tikka. It was good . In dessert i only had a vanilla ice cream so can't comment on their dessert range right now .
name: Lazy Bear

review: A new place in Hudson Lane !!!! First of all amazing hospitality and amazing service. The ambiance is pretty decent, dj is fantastic and the word goa says it all in terms of food . They have some special goan dishes which you don't find it in most of the places. So people who are fond of those dishes, this is the place to be !! Coming to the food i had Cheese pao bhaji , paneer tikka , dahi k kebabs , cigar rolls and chocolate dome. I loved the pao bhaji and the two way paneer tikka. The paneer was so soft and delish. The presention of all the items were upto the mark. The chocolate dome was a little extra sweet but the delicious chocolate made us ignore that . Overall a great new place...read more
name: GOA

review:
I was around this place few days back and decided to try it out. I was quite intrigued by the menu and decided to give chicken tikka massala ( with lachha parantha ) a try . A totally liked what i had .
After having this i decided to have shahi paneer and lachha parantha. It looked as tempting as it tasted . A thumbs up to their food .
Its more of a take away and delivery outlet .
Also,they have few rolls and a variety of Indian Main course options.
A great option for people in MG Road to order their meal from .
name: The Kitch-INN

review:
I went to this place yesterday to have a quick lunch. I had cold coffee , indian tadka pasta and paneer makhani pizza. The coffee was fine, the pasta was a little undercooked and the pizza had a nice base.
Coming to the staff and the service, they got our entore order in 15 minutes. The were cleaning the tables like they do in a fast food chain after every customer. The staff lacked hospitality and welcoming gesture.
name: The Chai Story

review:
I went to spend my evening here . The staff was welcoming, ambiance was decent and the sofas were very comfortable.
We ordered lotd special veg pizza, aglio e olio and Caesar salad. The pizza was thin, crispy andblowded with veggies . It tasted good. Aglio e olio was spicier but tasted decent. The salad was not upto the mark and needs improvement.
In mocktails i had orange crush which was really refreshing.
name: Lord Of The Drinks Chamber

review:
One of the best options to order your asian food . So i ordered from here for the first time and the experience was good .
I ordered veg dimsums ( assorted veggies with cheese ) , thai green curry and pad thai noodles. The pad thai noodles and curry are totally recommended to those who like thai food. The dimsums were also fine.
name: T'Wok - A Pan Asian Experience

review:
A new bee in Gujrawala Town !!
I ordered Dal makhni combo , paneer lababdaar combo and kathri rumali roti. The combos were a combination of one veg/dal along with one bread , mint sauce and onions. The Paneer had a nice gravy but slightly on the sweeter side. The kathi had soya chaap, paneer and thick gravy which tasted just fine . Their mint sauce was too delish .
The combos are very economically priced and one combo is sufficient for a single person's meal.
name: Brunch Bee

review: I saw this place while strolling in CP and decided to have dinner here. There seems no arrangement for sitting on ground floor so i went up to the first floor. I found myself a table and sat there. I noticed the AC wasnt working and it was getting really hot. I called the staff and then he switched it on with a remote right in front of me. They should have done it before themselves . It was Sunday and peak dinner hours . I ordered a Sambar Vada and a Deluxe Thali. The vada was cold and tasted absolutely zero . Next came the thali which was just fine . If you here this can be the safe thing to order . Next we ordered a soft drink can and it took them 10 minutes to get it strangely. The...read more
name: Hira Sweets

review:
What a pretty bakery !!!!! The most beautiful bakery you will come across in North Delhi.
They have sitting too, Inside and outside both .
I had pao bhaji , vegetable pizza , cold coffee , mint mojito and chocolate tart. The pizza topped the list .
The prices are not very expensive . The quality seems good.
Apart from pastries, cake , snacks , they have breads , biscuits and alot more stuff . If you are in NSP and gotta stop to munch on a little , this is the place to be !!
name: Wheat Basket

review:
So i went to echoes around a week back from today with a friend . We started with oreo shake and aam bunta. Both of them tasted fine but we expected the shake a little fancy like other places these days . In food , we had veg tandoori momos which tasted great followed by chicken popcorn that came in a tiffin. The last we tried white sauce penne pasta . Pasta was perfectly boiled and the taste was just right .
Recommendation -
üíñ veg tandoori momos
name: Echoes Satyaniketan

review:
Yesterday i went to this place with a friend around 6pm. We made ourselves comfortable on the first floor. We started with rockey barley salad with pomegranate and cottage cheese followed by christmas canopies . I really liked the canopies. The taste was just appropriate. Next we tried Cuban cigar rolls which were delicious followed by parmesan drumsticks which were again delish but oilier than it should be. From the main course we tried otv special burger pizza which could be worked on a little as it was really dry.

Recommendations -

1. Christmas Canopies
2. Cuban cigar rolls

name: Out Of The Box

review:
Yesterday i ordered Paneer cheese momos , hakka noodles and chilli garlic noodles from this place. They reached little late than expected but the packing was fine and so was the taste.
The momos were tasting so good along with the dip that came along. For the people who like spice , chilli garlic noodles will be just perfect.
Overall my experience from this place was good.
name: Tasty Noodle Twist

review:
I went to this outlet yesterday evening . They have sitting sufficient enough for 18 people at a time. The outlet smelled a little but the staff said its because of curd. So coming to what i tried -
1. Blueberry regular yogurt with 4 toppings . I loved the flavour and in topping my favourite was choco chip.
2. Parfait regular again . It was Mango and Chocolate flavour yogurt with Three toppings. My favourite topping in parfait being the butterscoth.
3. Green Apple smoothie with two toppings. I too the smallest size because i wasn‚Äôt sure if i would like it but yes it was good.
So recommended toppings-
1. Butterscotch
2. Choco chip
name: Cocoberry

review: So i went here few days back in the evening on a Weekend. It was really very crowded. I had great expectation from this place because it was busy so assumed food must be delish. I had white sauce pasta and brownie with vanilla. The later was just okaish. The pasta was good but i‚Äôve had a lot better pastas in North Delhi. Also, quantity of pasta was less than it should be in a full plate.
name: Mr. Crust Bakers

review:
A great place for a day out with friends or cousins. They have bowling , football , cricket , virtual reality games , car games , bike games , air hockey and a lot more. 
Apart from games , you can eat and drink there. They have a lounge inside . We had pizza , chicken tikka , butter chicken fries and chicken popcorn. I loved the chicken tikka whereas popcorn needs to be worked on. 
Recommendations :
Bowling 
Chicken tikka
name: Smaaash

review:
I was in Dwarka on Sunday and decided to take away some items on my way back. I had chocolate truffle pastry which was good, blue berry muffin which was amazing , coffee macron again amazing , chocolate cupcake which wAs just fine and chicken and paneer roll. Inspite of getting them heated they were cold from inside and hence didnt seem good at taste.
Recommendations-
1. Blueberry muffin
2. Coffee macron
name: Honey & Dough

review: I went here on a Saturday for dinner. It was jam packed , noisy and there was chaos all around. Also, there was a waiting for 10-15mnts but luckily we made a reservation before hand . The ambiance is on the average side , the waiters were little confused on which table to deliver which order because of so many people dining there. Coming to the food , we had boneless butter chicken , tawa soya chaap , one more non veg dish and breads. The colour of the butter chicken was strange but it tasted fine. The tawa chaap was average. We get lot better chaap in other places in north delhi. In breads only the naan was fine. The rest breads were just average. The price of the dishes is not...read more
name: Sandoz

review:
Overhyped is the word !!
Tooooo oily . The roll was 80% oil and 20% chicken and egg. I had a single chicken and single egg roll. The roll was wholesome. Sufficient quantity of chicken and egg and alot of onions but all felt bad bcs of the oily parantha they were wrapped in.
Also one roll and you are full .
name: Nizam's Kathi Kabab

review:
I ordered lunch from this place yesterday. The food reached me hot, well packed and right on the committed time.
I had a chicken combo which had noodles , hot garlic chicken gravy , chicken dimsum ( two pieces ) and coke. The entire combo was delish.
In veg , i ordered manchow soup, hakka noodles and chilly garlic noodles. The manchow was a little different but tasted good. Both the noodles were excellent in taste. Also there was no excess oil which we usually find in chinese food.

Recommendations-
1. Chicken combo
2. Chilli garlic noodles

name: Mandarin House

review: So i had to kill time in CP for some reason and decided to have coffee at this place. They didn‚Äôt have hot coffee so i ordered a cold one. The glass was all shabby and sticky because of the froth trickling down the glass. Not just that, it didn‚Äôt even taste good. It was very average .
name: Surahi The Veg Kitchen and Bar by The Rajkamal

review:
I got to know that Chaayos has launched egg bun , chilly cheese toast and lassi . I had to try them so i went there with a friend today. I started with chilly cheese toast. It was love in first bite. A 10/10 for this one. Also its really healthy as the toast is multi grain bread . Next we tried the egg one which was okaish but the people who love boiled eggs are gonna like it.
Coming to the lassis , i really liked the mint lassi. The strawberry lassi is only for the die hard strawberry lovers.

Recommendation -

1. Chilly cheese toast üíõ
2. Mint lassi
name: Chaayos - Meri Wali Chai

review:
I went to this place late evening with a friend. We sat on the terrace as the music was very loud in the lounge. It had dim lights with a lot if sitting space.

We had cheese nachos , cheese garlic bread , massala soya chaap and cold coffee. The nachos and cold coffee were good followed by soya chaap which was just fine. The garlic bread was little bland and lacked flavour.

Recommended : Cheese nachos , cold coffee üíõ
name: 736 A.D.

review: Visited this place 2 days ago. The ambience is very nice with variety of alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks. I enjoyed the music and was surprised to see a nice Chinese restaurant with amazing sea food and other cuisines as well specially veg hakka noodles‚Äôs taste was exceptional . The staff was polite and was well versed with the menu.
name: The Golden Dragon

review:
I ordered my dinner from this place 2 days back. I wanted to have a healthy meal and decided to give their wrap and sandwich a try. I loved the double decker chicken sandwich. It was delicious and tasty at the same time. The soya wrap was green in colour as it was made from palak and inside was the filling of inhouse minced soya. The mint sauce that came along added to the taste.
In drinks i tried the daily detox drink. It didn‚Äôt disappoint me either.
A great place for people on diet , gym freaks and health conscious people.
name: Nutritious Nation

review:
I was in CP for some work and i got free around lunch time. I thought to give this place a try. They have launched monster rolls . I tried the veg one. It was filled with rice , mayo , onion and a sauce . The roll was so delicious and the size was more than enough for a single person. I also had a soya chaap which was much smaller but good.
I really liked their cold coffee as well. My friend tried pink mojito which was average.

Recommendations -
1. Monster roll
2. Cold coffee
name: The Rolling Joint

review: Visited this place over lunch with friends . Its 3 months old with a little dark interiors . The place is spacious with three private areas to host your private party. Coming to the service , the servers are great and take care of your meal really nicely. They keep asking if food is okay and you are satisfied. Now lets talk about food. In starters we had mushroom croquettes , onion rings and fish fingers. A 11/10 to the mushroom croquettes. They were the best i‚Äôve had so far. Onion rings were thick and crispy . The fish could improvise . The dips given along with the three added to the taste. Coming to the main course , we had aglio e olio , butter chicken and breads. The pasta was...read more
name: Station Bar

review: What a beauty !! This place has a lovely terrace - beautiful and all good vibes. I would say its one of a kind in north delhi. They are indoor also on the first floor . The food is great in quality , amazing presentation , sufficient quantity and good at taste. I tried fish and chips , aglio e olio & mini pizzas. I loved aglio e olio the most followed by fish and chips. The former had right amount of seasoning . The tartar dip & salsa dip tasted great ! The three mini pizzas look really cute and in this way you get a variety as all are different . In desserts i was recommended choco lava gulab jamun served with ice cream. It was delish !! A must try but you cant eat it alone. Coming...read more
name: Boa Village

review:
I ordered nacho corn chaat , crispy soya wrap and tandoori chicken burger. The delivery took place inspite of bad weather. Thanks to the courteous staff.
The packing was fine. The nachos were crisp and the chaat was delicious.
The soya wrap was tasted fine. The soya was crispy and the sauces were delicious.
The chicken in tandoori wrap tastes more of smoked and less of tandoori but it was good. The quantity was wholesome.

Recommendation : Nacho corn chaat üíõ
name: Burgrill

review: Today I tried their bowl concept. Its really user friendly and an innovative concept. You can eat in the bowl itself . I ordered rajma chawal and veg biryani. The former tasted good but i guess the proportion of rajma should be increased. The latter was filled with vegetables like carrot , potato and beans. It tasted great .
name: The Good Bowl

review: Visited this pretty place on Wednesday with a friend over lunch. We opted for the buffet. It was a reasonable buffet in which we could have 4 starters , 2 main course , 1 soup and 1 dessert. I didnt try the soup and dessert because they were not of my taste . I loved the starters both veg and non veg. In veg loved the fried potato cheesy ball thing and in non veg loved the honey chilly chicken. In main course , we had kadhai chicken , paneer butter massala and butter naan. Everything was just delicious. I ordered an aglio olio apart from this buffet and it tasted perfect . Talking about the service , they have got courteous staff and hard working chefs. Overall a great experience and...read more
name: Informal by Imperfecto

review: I visited Local with a friend last Wednesday to have lunch. I easily managed to get a comfortable table . The staff was hospitable and the service was on time. In starters i had veg platter in which i really liked the soya chaap and hara bhara kebab. Also , i had fish fingers which were soft and crispy. In main course , my friend had veg biryani which came alone with raita and chutney. It looked so fresh and delicious. I had boneless butter chicken and butter naan. The naan was so tasty . The gravy of the butter chicken was thick and toothsome. In desserts we had chocolate fantasy that came along with choco lava cake. It was over sweet but a must order for chocolate lovers....read more
name: Local

review: I went to this place today for lunch with my friend. It was 70% occupied and running well . The ambiance is pretty decent . The first floor give a nice view of the ground floor and cp outside. The staff is hospitable , courteous and good at their respective work. My order reached my table in 10 minutes. I had chicken skewers with pita bread & veg burger with corns selected as sides. Both of them were too good. The buns of the burger were very soft. The skewers were perfectly grilled and pita bread was soft , fresh and as it should be. The corns i didnt like much . In desserts , we had chocolate cake , custard tart and pineapple with vanilla scoop. The chocolate cake was over sweet but...read more
name: Nando's

review:
I crossed this place and tried matar kulche from this place. They tasted fine . The plate was of Rs 40 and they gave 3 mini kulchas in it. They even refilled because the matar finished before the kulcha.
They need to pep up in terms of hygiene and increase a little variety of snacks.
name: Malik Sweets & The Baker's Oven

review:
They have opened a new shop which is about 2 months old. Probably the best paan shop in terms of ambiance. They have more than 100 flavours.
I tried alot of pans like chocolate , mango dipped , butterscotch and pina colada. I liked butter scotch the best.
They have small jars of supari , soaf , gulukand , etc which are also worth trying .

If you are a pan lover , you are gonna love their pans.

Recommendation - Butter scotch paan üíõ
name: Pandey's Paan

review:
I was in CP & totally hungry at the moment. I went to this place and decided to try some of their food. I ordered cold coffee , pao bhaji , chicken burger and warehouse special veg pizza .
Cold coffee - usual frape , tasted fine.
Veggie pizza - Delicious thin crust pizza with loads of cheese and vegetables.
Pao bhaji - Wholesome bhaji with 3 mini paos served with mint sauce and onions .
Chicken burger - Too big to eat all alone but tasted amazing !!

The staff was hospitable and the ambiance can be described as dim lighted and little loud music even during luncheon hours.

Recommendations : All veggie pizza and chicken burger.
name: Warehouse Cafe

review:
I ordered dinner from this place last night. Its a late night kitchen . The food reached me few minutes late than expected but taste was too good.
I had mushroom tikka , soya chaap massala and stuffed paranthas. All of these were good.
The mushroom tikka was extra spicy but undoubtedly delish. The gravy of soya chaap was finger licking good. The aalo parantha was stuffed well and delicious.

name: Tikka Darbar

review:
This place has introduced a new concept of meal in the bowls. Its quote innovative and user friendly.
The bowl quality is upto the mark and the packing was perfect.
I tried mac n cheese , butter chicken chawal and chole chawal. The quantity of chicken in the chawal was very less . Chole chawal bowl tasted decent. Mac n cheese was just fine.
Good luck to this new place having multiple outlets üíõ
name: The Good Bowl

review:
Beautiful is the word !!
What a lovely place üíõ and the food here looks lovely too.
A 10/10 for the food , presentation , staff and ambiance of the place.
The terrace is too pretty to give it a miss.
In food i loved the veg spring rolls and veg Caesar salad. In chicken , malai chicken tikka amd chilly chicken both were good. Chicken was really soft and well cooked.
I also tried soya chaap which tasted fine and pizza looked so beautiful üòõ
Good looking place with good food !!

Recommendations :
1. Veg Spring rolls
2. Veg caesar salad
3. Chilly chicken

name: Bokan

review:
Visited this place saturday evening and it was moderately occupied , i mean the terrace of the place.
The interiors of the place are decent and theme is ofcourse judiciary .
In food , i liked chicken sandwich and butter chicken momos. Chicken tikka was also fine. In veg i only tried jalape√±o cheese balls and they tasted just okay.
Recommendation -
Chicken sandwich
name: Judge & Jury

review: I would want to give this place a 3.5 but there is no option to do so , so consider this rating done by me a 3.5. Speaking of the ambiance , it goes perfect with their concept. The tables , chairs , walls , old school refrigerator and phone all do justice to the theme. The service is a 3.5/5. They should be a more hospitable to everyone coming there and nicely greet them. Its Claridges so such a thing should be there. In food , i had dal makhni , butter chicken , butter naan , pudina parantha , aalo parantha and mirch parantha. Dal makhni was little bitter and i didnt like it. Butter chicken was great and so was its gravy . It seemed the taste came from a lot of desi ghee that had...read more
name: Dhaba - The Claridges

review:
I was in Amritsar for a day and decided to visit this famous restaurant over dinner. The lift took us to the first floor. The ambiance is very classy . The place is neat and clean with very courteous staff. It looks like a find dine cum lounge.
Coming to the food now. We ordered manchow , dal makhni , mushroom massala and breads.
Manchow was delish but dal makhni needs improvement. Mushroom massala‚Äôs massala was tasty but the mushroom had water in it. The breads were fresh and good .
Recommendations: Veg Manchow soup üíõ
name: Crystal Restaurant and Lounge

review:
The finch is a new restaurant lounge in Gk. The interiors are black and grey giving the place a classy touch. The ground floor is fine dine , first floor is lounge and second floor is bar & where live music will happen.
I was here to check out this new place and try their food. This place alot more than dal makhni and butter chicken. They have a lot of different options to chose from. Out of all what i liked the most was bitter gourd salad. It was just perfect.
This place should definitely be visited on their special nights when the gig is gonna happen.
Overall a good experience !!
name: The Finch

review: I had soya tikka burger , caramel frappe and special spicy chicken burger. Out of these three the best one was the Frappe. The buns of the burgers were soft. The dressing seemed fine. Overall a fine experience with this place. Will try out more items from here in future.
name: Burgrill

review:
Ordered food from this place yesterday for dinner. In starters we ordered paneer tikka and kurkure soya chaap. The chaaps were really very good and crispy. The paneer tikka was also fine.
In main course we had dal makhni and paneer butter Massala. Dal is totally a yes from this place. Paneer could be improvised a little.
Recommendations :
1. Kurkure soya chaap
2. Dal makhni
name: Punjabi Angithi

review:
I went to this place on a saturday night for dinner. We had fish fingers , corn tempura and chicken tender .
The food was good specially the fish fingers. The ambiance was little dark and the music was really loud maybe because it was saturday.
Its a small place with great service and unlimited liquor packages.
name: Unlimited - The Break Free Bar

review:
Crazy butter chicken and okaish soya chaap massala. Butter naan was good too.
Service is fine.
Avoid weekend dinner as there is alot of waiting .
name: Havemore

review: During navratras i decided to try their meal meant for navratri. I ordered sabudana cutlets. The packing was perfect. The cutlets were really good. They were accompanied by curd and mint sauce. Its a great option to order during your fasts.
name: Faasos

review:
I ordered 3 desserts yesterday from zomato itself. The delivery was on time and the packing was upto the mark.
I ordered shahi tukra , brownie sundae and chocolate sandwich. The brownie sundae tasted good. It had two brownies with gems and two ice cream scoops. The chocolate sandwich seems to have Nutella spread in the white bread and it was grilled.
P.S - This outlet serves desserts only.
name: Dessert House By Cafe  Kebab-E-Desserts

Maybe it lost its charm during delivery as it had lost its warmth. The name read chilli but it wasnt spicy at all. 4. Veg frankie : I did not like this at all. The filling was of onion and cabbage. 5. Basil chicken dry : This was okaish. Order...read more
name: China Leaf

review: This is a new delivery joint in Hudson Lane. Hours of operation -- 11pm - 4am. . North Delhi people finally have a nice night delivery option when they are craving some delicious food.
name: Moonlight Delivery

review: This is a small food joint in Mayur Vihar 2 with a sitting of about 20 people. The location is easily spotted if you follow directions on google maps. The people already residing there must be acquanted with it already. For other, go with the map directions and you'll land right. I went there on a Sunday and managed to get a parking easily.
name: Sandwich Factory

review: A theme based lounge and bar where the theme of course is cars. As the name goes , this lounge revolves around super cars . Even the name of the drinks certain are theme based.  The ambiance is really amazing. TheDJ is rocking but after 9pm.
name: Raftaar - The High Speed Lounge & Bar

review: BED is a recently opened lounge and bar in GK1 and this has been on my check list since the opening. I finally visited this place yesterday i.e Sunday and my experience was amazing. The place looks really classy. The sitting is comfortable. The service is outstanding. The staff is very dedicated and good at their work. The manager too was concentrating alot on providing their customers the best of their service. Coming to food, i tried alot of things here. We were welcomed by a complimentary sides ( pappad ) kind of thing with a salsa dip. The dip was really tasty. We ordered- 1. Veg Caesar Salad : 5/5 for this. 2. Crunchy paneer tikka : Too good. Again 5/5 for this. Must try...read more
name: BED

review:
I ordered a vegetable biryani and a dessert from this place yesterday. My order was on time and service boy was courteous.

My biryani was " Paneer subz biryani " & my dessert was " Bahar-e- Gulkand " . The biryani was of sound quality and tasted as perfect as it could. A true delight for biryani lovers. The vegetables seemed fresh and the rice was well cooked. I highly recommend their biryani to all the biryani fans.

Gulkand was good too.
name: Behrouz Biryani - Royal & Safe

review: Telegram is a sweet and little cafe on the busy competitive cafe lane of hudson lane. The interiors are simple yet catchy at the same time. The food is amazing but the service was slightly slow. I had - 1. Mushroom cheese cigar rolls : The presentation was very attractive. They tasted as good they looked. 2. Mushroom crossitini : Loved it . 3. Mushroom kurkure : Again too good. I could have it anytime again. 5/5 for the presentation as well. 4. Baked nachos : Good but i've had better nearby this place. 5. Paneer lababdaar : I'm not a paneer lover but still i loved this dish. 6. Butter roti : No issues with this as well. Went well with the paneer 7. Butter scotch shake : A...read more
name: Telegram

review:
I ordered food from this place today. The delivery was on time. The delivery guy was courteous.

I had -

1. Paneer butter masala- this was amazing. No flaws at all. Finger licking good. #highly recommended

2. Mushroom Tikka - This was also good. Well cooked and appropriately spicy.

3. Tandoori chap - I didn't like this . The taste of chap was not good to taste buds. This should be improvised.

Overall a great place to order your starters and main course from. Pocket friendly and tasty food.

All the best to this new place.

Happy eating :)
name: Cook Sum Curry

review:
I had heard alot about their momos and therefore had high expectations. I ordered tandoori afghani momos from zomato and they got delivered a little late. Never mine , i was eager to taste them.

The tandoori momos were soaked in cream / mayo completely and it was looking excess. When i tasted it was the very case. The momos were good and well cooked but too much cream was very disturbing and unpleasant.

I could not completely have it all because of excess cream. Not very happy with my particular order.
name: Chalte Firte Momos & Special Foods

review:
I am in love with their food since i tasted their food for the very first time years back. Since then i keep craving for their thali once in a month.

A small dhaba with amazing food. Complete value for money. In fact a very pocket friendly place.

Their dal and soya champ ( kathi ) are just finger licking.
I love their butter naam and min sauce also ‚ù§Ô∏è

Highly recommended !!
name: Badri Prasad Ramesh Kumar Caterers

review: This shop came to me as a rescue when i was unable to find any eatery in central market . I was pretty hungry and the kfc was all jam packed with long queues and everything. I happened to try this place on a friend's suggestion. I had gol gappe , tomato & cheese sandwich and veg cheese burger. The gold gappe tasted average but seemed hygienic. The best part was that were 6 flavours of water put up and you can refill whichever u want yourself. The gol gappe water self service was the best part. Burger was good but nothing extraordinary. Rather, it didn't look or tasted much like burger. It tasted like sandwich in burger shaped breads. In such hunger it seemed good to me. Sandwich...read more
name: Golden Fiesta

review: Situated in the F block, middle circle of CP , this restraunt and bar is a delight to the youth who loves to move their body to some amazing tracks. Yes, this place has an amazing Dj who doesn't wait for the night to start his job. Many times i come across people who ask me to suggest a place where they could find Dj in the evening so here's the answer- excuse me boss .
name: Excuse Me Boss

review:
John carlos seems to be an attractive pizza option when you pass through the streets of hudson lane. I happened to order my pizza through food panda app. They were running an offer buy 1 get 1 when i ordered today and i have been reading about this scheme from quite a long time now.

I had -

1. Butter chicken pizza : This was thin crust , crispy and tasty. The chicken was well cooked and the pizza was different from what you have in other joints at hudson lane.

2. Mexican Veg : I loved this pizza in pan base. It was delectable , soft and veggies seemed fresh. Perfect option for veg pizza lovers.

The packing was firm and was accompanies by oregano and chilly flakes.
name: John Carlos

review:
Recommendations -

1. Chilly soya chaap roll
2. Chicken shwarama

I happened to pass this joint yesterday and was attracted by the name and shwarma posters on the well.
Its a take away and delivery outlet. There is no sitting space.
I tried soya chaap roll, chicken shwarama and malai chaap roll. Soya chaap roll was my favourite out of these.

One drawback was the time taken to give us our oder. The service was slow otherwise everything good.
Would try more items in my next visit.
name: The Yellow Chef

review:
A small take away outlet in Bunglow Road which is great option for college students. You can follow the direction on the map given ok zomato as the proper address isnt mentioned. The direction will lead you correctly.

There were alot of pending orders and quite crowded when i reached.
My hot chocolate fudge was given to me after 20 minutes . I've had better fudges at many places. The prices are pocket friendly but i didn't like the taste much. There was a certain tinge of taste we were not liking, maybe some kind of syrup or i don't know what.

Maybe the rest things are good. This place definitely going to be a regular visiting joint for college students.
name: Bistro 57

review: This restaurant is spread on the ground as well as on the first floor. The ground is a fine dine and the first floor is lounge . I visited this place yesterday ( Thursday ) and got myself a table on the first floor. The staff greeted us well and started with their service in a gentle manner.
name: 38 Barracks

review: I have been eating their kulfi's since years. Whenever you go , they are loaded with customers. No matter you go at night around 10.30. The service is fast and well managed. They serve the best kulfi sticks so far in North Delhi. Variety of flavours at throwaway prices starting from rs. 10 for plain , rs. 20 for mocha , chocolate and going to rs.30 for kesar pista , likewise.
name: Chaudhary Sweets Corner

review: The Tummy Section is a popular take away joint situated on Jail Road. After hearing a lot about their shawarmas' and many other delectable items , i finally decided to try this place out. I got my order packed . The packing was organised and tidy. Coming to the food. I tried -. 1. Chicken Shawarma : Wow ! This was too good. You don't feel like stopping while you are having their shawarma. The filling seemed fresh , soft and well cooked. Highly recommended whenever you are in the vicinity.
name: The Tummy Section

review: Getafix is a small cute cafe located in GK 1 , M block market market. It is on the first floor , very easy to locate and extremely health friendly. I went here on a Monday evening. There were 2 groups already having their meals. One of them was with their kids and the other one was a family too. So basically this place is for youngsters , families and everyone who loves healthy food. The place has organised sitting , decent staff , kiddish ambiance , clean washroom & last but not the least healthy food.
name: Getafix

review:
I went to palate fest today and happened to pass Al Yousuf stall . I read chicken shawarma roll in bold written there and thought to give it a try.

The shawarma roll was really tasty. The chicken was well cooked and tasted perfect. The mayo given along was even tastier. It was priced at Rs.150 at the fest.

Will definitely try more items from here if i happen to go to this place again.
name: Al Yousuf

review: A must visit place !!  This place will make you fall in love with it at the very first visit. The ambiance , the theme , the creatives , the food , the bar and the service - everything seemed perfect here. The place gives out some amazing vibes.
name: Prankster

review:
My rating is entire based on their cold coffee. I have been to this place more than 7 times and all i'v had is their cold coffee.
The other snacks at their shop never attracted me. I never found them presentable.

Cold coffee ( basic ) is great . Cold and slightly on the stronger side. The bottle is very easy to cold and drink from.

They've been selling the same coffee since years and people have been cherishing the taste since then.
name: Depaul's

review:
I went to this place on a Saturday evening and asked for a Nutella waffle. I was asked to wait for an hour due to alot of pending orders.
I came back another day, this time a saturday afternoon. In 25 minutes, i was given mu Nutella waffle.

It tasted fine but nothing extraordinary. If the vanilla had been a little more it would have been better. The waffle and vanilla were not in proportion.
The quantity of Nutella on the waffle was less and hence was giving a dry feel.

P.S - Sitting space is a major problem here
name: Wenger's Deli

review: I have been to this place twice in my life. One when the place was new and next a day before to this date. My first experience was good. . I have been to this place twice in my life. One when the place was new and next a day before to this date. My first experience was good. I had white sauce chicken pasta , a shake and a chicken dish. There was no issue in the taste , quality and service of this place at that time.
name: My Bar Headquarters

review:
This place is famous for non veg in vijay nagar. People really like the quanitity they offer.
If u buy quarter butter chicken you get a chicken piece free , if u buy half you get quarter free and likewise.

I'v never been inside and had my meal. I'v always got it home delivered.

The service was quick and on time.

The chicken tasted well cooked and good. Not that i'v not had better butter chicken. The breads too were fine.

I wont comment on the service inside the restaurant for now.
name: Chawla's Tandoori Xpress

review:
I have tried only one roll from here.

Soya champ keema roll priced Rs.90/-

The outer crust and sauces inside were tasty. I didnt like the keema. Could have been better .

They took 20 minutes to make my roll which is a lot of time when you are only two customers waiting for the order but its ok as their were only two people doing the work.

I dont recommend this roll . I would try the other rolls next time and give my review on them.
name: 34, Chowringhee Lane

review:
If you are looking for a place in Ashok Vihar to have some great mughlai food and amazing starters, this is the place to be.

Be it their dal makhni , kadhai paneer , butter chicken , mushrooms , spring rolls , veg platter or be it their any other dish , everything was awesome during my every visit.

Its not a party kind of place , its a family restaurant.
Go there for food , not for a party kind of feel .
name: Invitation

review:
I was a big time fan of this bakery. I used to love almost everything here. I had given 4 stars earlier but i am editing this review now from 4 to 2.5.

I bought paneer kulcha and kathi roll from this place today. While eating paneer kulcha i found a hair inside it. I was completely disgusted since then. Being such a renowned bakery working on such a good scale , these things should be taken care of.
Mr. Owner if you are reading this , please look into this.
name: The Master's Fast Food Centre

review:
The best chole bhature of this area. If you have not tried this yet , head to ashok vihar specially to get yours. I'm sure every body who resides in ashok vihar have had their chole bhature alot of times.

Service - 4/5
Quality - 4/5
Taste - 4/5
Value for money- 5/5
name: Nagpal's

review:
In eatery section mostly everything is good. This shop is running since many years and doing good business.

There is a gift / party supplies section also. They have great collection. Some of the products are prices very high as compared to market.

Recommended -

1. Breads
2. Pastries
name: Sethi's The Cake Shop

review:
Never crowded whenever i have been here unlike other Starbucks outlets.

Great service. Great coffees. Tidy place. Everything organised and ordered !!
name: Starbucks

review:
I keep having subway craving from time to time. I visited this outlet alot many times . On the basis of those visits here is my rating -

Staff - 4/5
Food - 4/5
Service - 3//5
Hygiene - 4/5
name: Subway

review:
When you are studying in Hansraj college , you are a regular visitor of food joints on bungalow road. I have been to this branch of mc Donald's alot of times. I was very regular here and i found no issues in their service .

It remains crowded during weekends and peek hours of weekdays. Sometimes it take 20 minutes or more to find yourself a seat.

The take away window of this place is also managed well. Though they take a long time to give your order.
Rest all good here :)
name: McDonald's

review:
After alot of waiting on a Sunday morning we managed to get a table here. This is the best place in kamla nagar to have poori chole but not the best in Delhi.

The bhaturas tasted great. The chole i found a little bland . The meethi lassi was amazing.

Hygiene - They should work a little on hygiene . The service was in such a hurry that he kept the plate in a second and ran away The puri on the plate which he bought was touching the table. Either the plate should be large in size or all this should be kept in mind.

Also, hats off the staff who manage such huge amount of crowd on Sunday mornings and keep working non stop
name: Bille Di Hatti

review:
I'm not a Bercos fan. In fact i'm not a chinese lover but i liked the food here.

I had noodles , manchurian , manchow soup , spring rolls and chilli potato. I really liked the noodles and chilly potato.

The servers were courteous.

The ambiance is tidy and organised.

Quality is maintained.

Overall a good place to have Chinese.
name: Berco's

review: 1. United states of Punjab burger ( veg ) Tasted great . Very heavy and stuffed. You'll be completely satisfied after having this one. 2. Keema pav veg burger The burger could have been better if the amount of beams would have been less. The tikki was good but too much of beams was ruining the taste a little. 3. Dilli 6 fries The masala on the fries was a little similat to the Cheetos massala taste. I liked the fries. 4. Hot shock fries Very spicy . A great choice for the spice lovers. 5. White guy dip A great company to the fries. 6. Banta Very different drink from what you usualky get at the outlets. Nice & refreshing. Do try when you are here for the burgers. P.S -...read more
name: Burger Singh - Big Punjabi Burgers

review: Chill'm is a hidden gem of north delhi. Only north campus people are aware about this place. Few years from now this little cafe used to be there on the same place it is now but alot of interior and ambiance has changed. We sat outside in the balcony kind of section . It looks pretty warm and beautiful. In food i loved the chicken tandoori momos. Chicken shawarma rolls were good but they simply were chicken rolls. Not shawarmas. Cold coffee ( frappe ) was fine as well but i'v had better at many places. The servers are less. We had to wait for someone to get the bill as the server was busy inside serving the customers. Servers should be increased. Value for money - A little...read more
name: Chill'm Bar N Cafe

review:
This is my favourite bakery in shalimar bagh.
Apart from the tasty pastries and cakes , they have some amazing snacks.

My personal favourite -

1. Kathi kabab with Rumali roti
2. Pav Bhaji
name: Ever Bake

review:
So this outlet is really famous for its vada pav and pao bhaji.
I tried both these things. The taste was great but it seems a little harmful for the body. Some spices in the vada pav were great in taste but bad for body.
name: New Arjun Bombay Pav Bhaji

review: I had dal makhni , mushroom , soya chaamp and paneer delivered at my cousin's place from this dhaba. The quality was just average. Taste was average. Nothing great about their food.
name: Sat Guru Dhaba

review:
I have had their burgers , sandwiches , pasties and many more things. The taste is good, quality is fine and service is quick.

A nice bakery to get food packed or even eat there. They have a little eating space also.
name: Baker's Factory

review: My experience here was as it would be in any of their outlets. In 10 minutes the order was ready. The staff was courteous. The burgers were fresh.
name: Dunkin' Donuts

review:
I have ordered from here a couple of times.
The service was on time.
The pizzas' seemed fresh.
The outlet had 2 tables and few chairs also for sitting.
A very small outlet where hardly 6-8 people can sit
Otherwise no option but to take away.
name: Domino's Pizza

review:
Small snack shop right next to embassy restaurant in inner circle D block.
It has a lot of light eating options & juices, coffee & tea. Such a outlet was needed in CP inner circle.
Very pocket friendly.
Very easy to locate.
Soul saver when you are hell hungry and the lounges have put you on 20 minutes waiting .

I happened to try only steamed momos . I loved them in this chilly weather.

Will try other stuff soon !!

name: Embassy Snack Shop

review: This cafe is very easy to locate. The very first cafe which you can see from the hudson lane red light. The interiors are kinda cool with cute mirrors on the ceiling and descent lighting. The servers are courteous. The service is on time. The staff is proficient in their work and gave their best service to satisfy us. In drinks , we had very berry ice blend and peach ice tea. Both were fine. Though i have had better ice teas. In starters , 1. Mushroom caps - loved it !! 2. Cigar rolls - treat for cheese lovers. Little bland but manageable. 3. Jalape√±o pop corns - Very tasty !! Must try this dish when you are here. In deserts , 1. Bonoffee pie - i am not a banana lover so...read more
name: The Hudson Cafe

review: Hudson chopsticks is another venture by The Hudson Cafe. It is a take away / delivery outlet only. Very neat and hygienic look it gives as you enter the place. The chefs wear head caps and gloves while doing their work. The staff seemed dedicated and was working property to the satisfaction of their clients. I ordered veg manchow , hakka noodles , veg manchoorian & honey chicken with seasame seeds. Amazing food. Everything tasted superb. The quality of oil and ingredients used seemed flawless. By far the best Chinese i have had in this area. A big applause for the chef and the entire team of this outlet. Great job guys !!!! I little strand of hair happened to be there when i opened...read more
name: Hudson Chopsticks

review:
For God's Cake is a cute bakery cum cafe . The ambiance is more on the sweeter side. For the bakery stuff, it's self service. You need to pay first and then go to the counter to get you pastery / cupcake / tarts or whatever you want to have.
I only tried their tiramisu pastry . It was good. I wont say it was exceptional but yeah deserves a visit.
name: For God's Cake

review:
Not the same now as it used to be when it newly opened. Everything tastes good but earlier it used to be very good.

There is 10-15 mnts waiting whenever i go there. They try to deliver their service asap although.
name: BTW

review: The place is spacious enough. Have been here only once and i didn't like their onion rings at all. The burgers were average. Not coming here again.
name: Burger King

review:
Great bakery. All items taste good.
Heavy rush in weekend evenings. Alot of take away orders , alot of packings and alot of passing buy poeple stopping to have their snacks here.

They recently opened their shop on the main road too.
name: Master's Cakes And Sweets

review:
Here is the rating based on my experience -

1. Service - 8/10
2. Ambiance - 7/10
3. Food - 8/10
4. Value for money - 6/10
5. Music - 7/10
name: Berco's

review:
Over hyped !!!!

First there was a 25 minutes waiting. Even after that if you don't get good food, you land up being super disappointed .

I had dal makhni , Kadhai paneer & breads. I only liked the breads. The main course tasted bad. Not going here again.
name: Veg Gulati

review:
Route 04 had a descent and nice ambiance. The music in the background is good no matter which day you go. The servers are courteous. The service is on time. I somehow like the vibes of the one in khan market more.

In food i just had potato bites & veg pasta. Both were good specially the pasta. Will be coming over again to try other things.
name: Route 04

review: So many years have passed but the taste is still the same. I loved the main course. The starters too were nice. Overall a nice place to have a meal in central delhi when you are bored of your regular party places.
name: Blues

review:
I have been to this place a couple of times. The day i went some band's live performance was going on. They were good. The ambiance too is good. When it comes to food, i am never satisfied after dining here.
I had there veg platter , onion rings & tried few shakes. I found all of them fine but not very good.
name: Hard Rock Cafe

review: Amongst the busy lanes of chandni chowk , you find haldiram's to relieve you from hunger ; specially when you are not in a mood of eating chandni chowk street food. This place has a ground floor ( stand & eat ) , first floor ( sitting ) & second floor ( sitting ). This place is really disorganised. If you are sitting on the first floor and you go to the counter and ask for kathi roll, vada pao or many other things, they ask you to go to the cashier counter on the ground floor to order it. Now this was really irritating. So we had pani puris on first floor & kathi roll and vada pao on ground floor. You can eat comfortably here. You have to struggle and then eat. If we talk about...read more
name: Haldiram's

review:
I ordered from east patel nagar. They took a little more than 1 hour to deliver. This was really disappointing. The service should be maximum 40 minutes.

I had veg burger , kurkure champ , chilli mushrooms & curd bombs. Everything was nice but the burger's tikki was not properly cooked. The burger tasted similar to aalo tikki burger from mc donalds but overpriced as compared to mc donalds burger.

I recommend-

1. Kurkure champ
2. Curd bombs

A must try place to eat when you are in patel nagar and feeling hungry.
